verb.description: Waste time, money, or energy on trifling matters.
examples: I wish we hadn't frittered the money away so easily
they become frittered into minute tatters

noun.description: A piece of fruit, vegetable, or meat that is coated in batter and deep-fried.

origin: Late Middle English: from Old French friture, based on Latin frigere (see fry). Compare with frittata.
